title: Engineer Senior tops FTSE 250 after rating upgrade
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Mon, Oct 26, 2015, 12:29 GMT - UK Markets close in 4 hrs 1 mins Engineer Senior tops FTSE 250 after rating upgrade By Tara Cunningham | Telegraph – 53 minutes ago 553.00 +1.5000 
Shares (Berlin: DI6.BE - news ) in Senior (Other OTC: SNIRF - news ) rose by more than 5pc after Investec (LSE: INVP.L - news ) lifted the group's rating to "buy" 
Engineering group Senior became the biggest riser on the mid-cap index after a rating upgrade. 
Investec lifted the stock’s rating to “buy”, saying it believed the shares were “oversold” and “undervalued”. 
The stock leapt by as much as 13.3p, or 5.6pc, to 250.3p in early morning trade as the broker said it expected the FTSE 250 group’s trading to be “relatively resilient” and supported by both good cash generation and a strong balance sheet, despite negative earnings momentum. Senior 1-day graph (Source: Bloomberg) 
Despite upgrading the stock's rating, the broker downgraded its earnings per share forecasts. For 2015, it reduced EPS expectations by 6pc to reflect increasing headwinds in Senior's Flexonics business - which manufactures heat exchange solutions for the energy and diesel engine markets. 
Thomas Rands, of Investec, said: “We believe our new forecasts not only capture the current headwinds, for Flexonics, but also build in some contingency.” 
Investec also reckons management will confirm conditions have deteriorated across its truck, automotive, power and energy markets over the past two months. Analysts do not forecast growth in operating margins in its aerospace division. 
However, amid the negatives, Investec believe Senior's “programme positions, operational flexibility, good and consistent cash generation and robust balance sheet” are all attractive - and undervalue the group at its current share price. 
Shares in Senior have fallen by more than 17pc so far this year, and while Investec acknowledges investors are likely to be concerned about the number of downgrades it has received recently, the broker says Senior's performance has been in line with its peers who have faced similar challenges. 
Investec is not the first broker to turn positive on an engineering company despite the slew of negative notes circulated in recent times. 
Only last week, Citigroup (Swiss: C.SW - news ) upgraded FTSE 100 Smiths Group (Other OTC: SMGKF - news ) as it believes the company’s new chief executive, Andrew Reynolds Smith, can offer it the “fresh start” it needs. 
Andrew Simms, of Citigroup (NYSE: C - news ) , said: “We believe a new chief executive provides a fresh perspective to address Smiths’ corporate strategy.” 
The move by the bank caused shares to rally by more than 2pc.
